revised_title: Trypanosomes in the Blood of Wild Animals Living in the Sleeping-Sickness Area, Nyasaland
tldr: The authors investigate the presence of trypanosomes in the blood of wild animals living in the sleeping-sickness area of Nyasaland. They examine 180 specimens of wild game and find that many animals are reservoirs of trypanosome disease, which could contribute to the spread and maintenance of the disease in the region.
